newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: BA tells Dutch clients not to book perishables.
newsitem.headline: BA tells Dutch clients not to book perishables.

text.p: British Airways Plc has advised its clients not to book perishable traffic on the carrier because of its three-day cabin crew strike.

A spokesman from BA's Dutch cargo department said that all seven daily flights to London Heathrow have been cancelled. But BA's flights from Schiphol and Rotterdam to London Gatwick, Birmingham and Manchester are operating as normal.
BA will not be deploying extra trucks on the route between the UK and the Netherlands, he said.
"We have told our clients in advance which flights they can book cargo and sent the schedules to the customers."
He admitted that BA expected the forwarders to take some business to other carriers.
The strike begins at 0500 gmt on Wednesday July 9 and ends at 0500 gmt on Saturday, July 12. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
